column1: We can all help our health care workers and reduce the strain on our hospitals if we follow the recommendations of doctors and public health experts.  👉 Wear a mask in public 👉 Social distance as much as possible 👉 Avoid crowds and large gatherings  https://t.co/VNzMTJeJrp

Thanks to decades of federally funded research and the work of scientists at home and around the world safe and effective vaccines are coming and we will defeat this virus. Until then we must continue to do what we can to slow the spread of COVID-19 in our communities.

Wearing a mask isn't just about you. It's also about the people around you.  The science is clear: masks significantly reduce the spread of #COVID19. That means less people in the hospital and less people dying.  😷 Mask up Illinois.
The numbers in our region are moving in the wrong direction and we all need to take action to reverse the trend.  We all want to get back to normal but our fight against #COVID19 is not over.

Private White House reports obtained by @COVIDoversight show that more than HALF of the U.S. is in the “red zone” for new coronavirus cases including Illinois.  Wear a mask. Wash your hands. Avoid close contact. Listen to science. https://t.co/XmMSf1fQnI

Despite the President's claims the #COVID19 pandemic is far from over. We're seeing alarming trends in many states including Illinois.  Please continue to follow the recommendations of public health experts and scientists and mask up when you're in public. https://t.co/DCUpQ4zXnw
